results.title: Saving Grace
results.creator_credit: Costa Botes, Larry Parr, New Zealand Film Commission and Kahukura Films
results.brief_description: When Grace, a homeless teenager whose emotional stability was shattered when her mother committed suicide, meets Gerald, an unemployed, compassionate carpenter, a tentative relationship develops between the two. Grace moves into Gerald’s house and their budding friendship gradually turns into love. Yet everything changes when Gerald reveals a stunning and incomprehensible secret— that he is the Son of God.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Costa Botes, Larry Parr, New Zealand Film Commission and Kahukura Films

results.title: Save those teeth
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of proper cleansing and care of teeth and illustrates how teeth are affected by excessive use of refined sugar. Identifies the kind of bacteria that change sugar to acid in the mouth. Demonstrates the use of sodium fluoride solution in the prevention of tooth decay and prescribes specific rules to be followed in the care of teeth.

results.title: Save this life
results.brief_description: The back-pressure arm-lift method of artificial respiration is shown by an instruction to Boy Scouts The correct position in which to place the patent and the position of the rescuer in relation to the patient is explained and the slow rhythmic action required is demonstrated with step-by-step commentary .

results.title: Save the soil
results.creator_credit: Raymond Evans and Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: A general discussion on the problem of soil conservation. Various ways in which soil can be conserved and protected are demonstrated, including: terracing; cover-cropping to prevent erosion; crop rotation; use of manures and commercial fertilizers.

results.title: Save the panda
results.creator_credit: Miriam Birch, WQED and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: There may be no more than 1,000 pandas left in the world. As a result of this, scientists, sponsored by a joint China-World Wildlife Fund project, are attempting to learn more about these rare animals. This film examines the studies, being performed by leading panda experts, at the Wolong Natural Reserve in the People’s Republic of China.

results.title: Save the lady
results.creator_credit: Leon Thau, Barry Pierce and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A bunch of kids on hearing that a beloved steam ferry “The Lady Hope” has been decommissioned and due for the scrap heap decide to rescue the boat from destruction. They use the help from some of their adult allies to help rally against the government in an escalating and hilarious caper that promises to save the ‘Lady’. A child’s fantasy is saved when the kids command a string of well-hatched decoys to shrug off the threatening eyes of the government whilst restoring dignity to the historical boat. Includes footage of the city and bays around Hobart, Tasmania (Australia). Suitable for children 6-12 years.

results.title: Save the Earth, feed the world
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Veronica Young, Jane West, Andrew Liebman, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines world food production and the challenge of feeding a growing population. The program discusses the environmental damage caused by conventional, intensive farming in both industrial and developing countries and the worldwide movement to replace conventional methods with low-input, sustainable agricultural practices. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Save the children: Christmas carols and festive songs
results.brief_description: Christmas songs sung by the London companies of recent stage hits such as “Les Miserables”, “Cats”, “Chess” and “The Phantom of the Opera”. The singers include Elaine Paige, David Essex and Michael Crawford. The songs are sung in full costume and include “Ding Dong Merrily on High”, “Away in a Manger”, “White Christmas”, “God Rest Ye Merry Gentlemen”, “In the Bleak Midwinter”, “Silent Night”, “Let’s Pretend”, “Save the Children”, “O Come All Ye Faithful” and “Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer”.

results.title: Save our soil
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Surveys India’s efforts to conserve soil in an effort to meet the challenge of rain and flood. The indiscriminate cutting of trees, the unplanned cultivation of slopes and uncontrolled grazing, all helped to rob the country of thousands of acres of land that were once fertile. Counter-terracing, strip cropping, trenching, and above all, afforestation schemes are undertaken to restore the balance of nature.
